turns.speaker: laura
turns.text: i like that one the best as well

turns.speaker: kerri
turns.text: so 10% to seniors, 15% to refuse and recycling and the rest have 25%

turns.speaker: nate
turns.text: well, water and sewer , roads - those should be high - but recycling seems too high, isn't a lot of that privatized anyway?

turns.speaker: jenifer
turns.text: I like Kerri's idea

turns.speaker: kerri
turns.text: I don't know, the whole recycling movement has taken off I think funding should be directed there more too

turns.speaker: jenifer
turns.text: Yes but it's not just recycling ... it garbage too

turns.speaker: lisa
turns.text: right

turns.speaker: jenifer
turns.text: Landfills are expensive

turns.speaker: nate
turns.text: right - like in most municipalities - you pay for it yourself

turns.speaker: jenifer
turns.text: But , as in back to the future, in a year we can put the trash in the car for gas - right

turns.speaker: laura
turns.text: haha true

turns.speaker: nate
turns.text: there are trash collection stations, those are sort of supported by the town - but i know in Guiderland and Niskayuna for example,

turns.speaker: kerri
turns.text: Yeah but Albany has city collection

turns.speaker: nate
turns.text: your taxes DO NOT pay for trash pick up or recycling pick up and disposition, nor processing - thats all done by yourself

turns.speaker: nate
turns.text: Albany City? really

turns.speaker: kerri
turns.text: Yes

turns.speaker: nate
turns.text: wow, so the city pays for that? -

turns.speaker: kerri
turns.text: I don't pay for trash at all

turns.speaker: nate
turns.text: thats pretty good - so maybe you'd allocate some money there, in this particular case

turns.speaker: laura
turns.text: me either

turns.speaker: kerri
turns.text: if we're talking about a city, then getting rid of trash is important

turns.speaker: nate
turns.text: the town does own and operate a transfer station, but the percentage is proly too high - i wont quibble on details though , it might make sense just to make this easy

turns.speaker: jenifer
turns.text: I think I am deciding that Highways and Roads need the most

turns.speaker: jenifer
turns.text: Water and Sewer next

turns.speaker: jenifer
turns.text: And the Library and Seniors on the next tier

turns.speaker: nate
turns.text: yeah, with the way Americans drive and how this is so car-centric and theres so much sprawl and lack of public transportation and high speed trains that europe and asia has, we should spend a lot more on roads

turns.speaker: laura
turns.text: true

turns.speaker: laura
turns.text: good point

turns.speaker: jenifer
turns.text: Hey ... they tried to build a monorail system through downtown Seattle and the tax payers shot it down

turns.speaker: jenifer
turns.text: It was soooo expensive

turns.speaker: kerri
turns.text: hahaha i'm not surprised

turns.speaker: laura
turns.text: yeah sounds like it

turns.speaker: jenifer
turns.text: Even in places like Seattle with TONS of public transportation people won't use it

turns.speaker: nate
turns.text: american cities dont have rails

turns.speaker: lisa
turns.text: how about this?: Seniors 8%, Refuse and Recycling 10%, Libraries 15%, Water and Sewer 34.5%, and Highway and Roads 30.5 %

turns.speaker: jenifer
turns.text: They had insentives were you could get paid to take it

turns.speaker: lisa
turns.text: this is a mixture of what some people said before

turns.speaker: nate
turns.text: ny is really the only true exception

turns.speaker: lisa
turns.text: although the water and highway might be switched based on what was just said

turns.speaker: jenifer
turns.text: You mean NYC

turns.speaker: kerri
turns.text: no, there's a whole rail system in san francisco

turns.speaker: jenifer
turns.text: or NY

turns.speaker: nate
turns.text: no New York

turns.speaker: lisa
turns.text: chicago too

turns.speaker: jenifer
turns.text: I live in Cortland

turns.speaker: nate
turns.text: a lot of people refer to it just simply as New York

turns.speaker: jenifer
turns.text: and there is no public transportation

turns.speaker: jenifer
turns.text: There are short buses for the disables and that is it

turns.speaker: nate
turns.text: NYC is like if you're going to differentiate b/n upstate and downstate, but upstate is not really that important in comparison

turns.speaker: nate
turns.text: so most people in the U.S. - when they say New York, it means the city, not the state

turns.speaker: nate
turns.text: who cares about NYS? people care about New York (the city, not the state)

turns.text: lol, not to us new york staters

turns.text: That is why I asked and you said the state

turns.speaker: jenifer
turns.text: but you mean the city

turns.speaker: kerri
turns.text: the rest of use care about the giant state too

turns.speaker: nate
turns.text: yeah, but New York states are the minority when you're talking about a country of 300 million people that views New York as the city

turns.speaker: nate
turns.text: i care about it too, New York State

turns.speaker: nate
turns.text: definitely

turns.speaker: nate
turns.text: so anyway -

turns.speaker: jenifer
turns.text: you lost me

turns.text: me too

turns.text: soooo

turns.speaker: laura
turns.text: back to the percentages?

turns.speaker: kerri
turns.text: lol

turns.speaker: lisa
turns.text: how about this? - Seniors 8%, Refuse and Recycling 10%, Libraries 15%, Water and Sewer 34.5%, and Highway and Roads 30.5 %

turns.speaker: lisa
turns.text: or swtich highways and water, based on recent conversations

turns.speaker: nate
turns.text: no, you got to take 3 % away from seniors, give it to roads

turns.speaker: nate
turns.text: or something else, 8% is too high

turns.speaker: kerri
turns.text: Or one percent away from everything else, and that 4and to roads

turns.speaker: lisa
turns.text: ok, i'd go with that, kerri

turns.speaker: lisa
turns.text: than water/sewer and highways are about equal again

turns.speaker: nate
turns.text: no, roads are covered

turns.speaker: nate
turns.text: roads dont need more

turns.speaker: nate
turns.text: especially bc the town pays for town roads

turns.speaker: kerri
turns.text: I disagree

turns.speaker: kerri
turns.text: roads are such a high expense

turns.speaker: lisa
turns.text: i thought you said to give 4 to roads earlier?

turns.speaker: nate
turns.text: but roads in the town that are county roads, that connect towns, or that are part of interstates, those are all

turns.speaker: nate
turns.text: paid for by the state and tolls, and

turns.speaker: nate
turns.text: u also have federal roads and federal grants

turns.speaker: kerri
turns.text: I'm from upstate, and country town roads are obnoxious, 4 % more would go to plowing in winter, and potholes

turns.speaker: jenifer
turns.text: Roads include other things too, "In addition to its efficient snow removal and aggressive paving program, the Highway Department provides other seasonal programs such as spring cleanup, summer yard waste pickup, fall leaf pickup and snow and ice removal. Highway personnel are also responsible for the upkeep of 32 miles of sidewalks, as well as the maintenance of over 180 vehicles and equipment owned by the various Town departments."

turns.speaker: kerri
turns.text: agreed

turns.speaker: nate
turns.text: yeah, so then

turns.speaker: nate
turns.text: remove the remaining percentage from seniors, and give it to roads - keep seniors at 4 or 5 %

turns.speaker: nate
turns.text: the reason new york state is bankrupt right now, is because tax payers are paying pensions and health care for people who retired 30 years ago

turns.speaker: lisa
turns.text: sorry, now you are making seniors even less, i liked kerri's idea better of 1 percent from everything, making seniors 7, refuse 9, libraries 14, .......water 33 and roads 34

turns.speaker: nate
turns.text: 20 yrs ago and up

turns.speaker: kerri
turns.text: I think its more fair to compromise and take 1% from everything

turns.speaker: nate
turns.text: 7% on seniors, thats absurd

turns.speaker: nate
turns.text: what are you going to do with the roads? they're a mess

turns.speaker: lisa
turns.text: they have the highest allocation, though

turns.speaker: nate
turns.text: 7% on seniors, thats crazy i think

turns.speaker: nate
turns.text: well , if roads are too much, give some to water

turns.speaker: kerri
turns.text: yes, but there's a certain point of compromise that needs to happen with these discussion

turns.speaker: laura
turns.text: true

turns.speaker: jenifer
turns.text: We have 16 minutes to come to an agreement

turns.speaker: nate
turns.text: right, and thats why we're appealng to your reason, so that you may compromise and negotiate an amicable solution -- instead of grid lock demanding 90% for seniors

turns.speaker: lisa
turns.text: wait, i wasn't demanding 90 for seniors

turns.speaker: kerri
turns.text: lol we're not demanding 80% though hahaha

turns.speaker: nate
turns.text: like, hand over fist, extortion, ultimatum tactics

turns.speaker: jenifer
turns.text: If anyone is taking this way to seriously it's not us

turns.speaker: nate
turns.text: yeah i know, i'm just bored

turns.speaker: laura
turns.text: well we need to decide on something

turns.speaker: nate
turns.text: still - 7% is proly a tad high for seniors

turns.speaker: nate
turns.text: i think we could break that down , just a dite, reinvest the money in our roads and water treatment programs

turns.speaker: kerri
turns.text: i don't know, i mean, you'll be a senior one day too what if they get rid of your funding

turns.speaker: lisa
turns.text: seniors 6, refuse 9, libraries 14, .......water 34 and roads 34

turns.speaker: lisa
turns.text: right

turns.speaker: nate
turns.text: well - i dont know what kind of additional funding seniors are entitlted too - they already receive more funding than any other portion of the population

turns.speaker: nate
turns.text: they vote in the highest percentage and are clearly the most powerful, influential, and wealthy group of american society

turns.speaker: lisa
turns.text: 6 is a reduction from 7

turns.speaker: jenifer
turns.text: Well we can see who will be winning an AARP award this year

turns.text: lol

turns.speaker: jenifer

turns.text: haha
